title.native: サイダーのように言葉が湧き上がる
title.romaji: Cider no You ni Kotoba ga Wakiagaru
title.english: Words Bubble Up Like Soda Pop

description:
Cherry is a quiet boy who loves to make haikus based off of the things he sees. One summer day in a city in the Japanese countryside…

At a shopping mall, he meets Smile, a beautiful girl in a mask. Cherry has trouble speaking in anything but haikus, and Smile wears a mask to hide her big, braces-covered front teeth. The two of them get closer as the south wind blows. One day, the two of them learn from Old Man Fujiyama, a master of Haiku who’s started going senile, that he’s searching for a certain record.

“If I can hear this record again, I can remember… Something I don’t want to forget, but can’t remember…”

Cherry and Smile decide to help. This is the story of their summer, set in a shopping mall…

(Source: Hakuhodo DY Music & Pictures)
synonyms: Palabras que burbujean como un refresco
ถ้อยคำเอ่อล้นด้วยหัวใจรัก

node.description:
__[Website](https://www.agraph.jp/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4L0gz16xuM1as1OgYzh1SR)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/agraph)__

Kensuke Ushio, alternatively known by stage name agraph, is a Japanese musician, DJ, composer, arranger, programmer, remixer and member of rock band [Lama](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/lama/profile/).

When he was a child Kensuke learned to play the piano, while later at University he started studying arts and music, in addition to also learning how to use audio editing software like Pro Tools. At the age of 20, Kensuke first came in contact with the electronic music world known as techno. 

In 2007, he would start his solo career under the stage name agraph, this is when he started to create his own electronic music. His debut album titled A Day, Phases, produced by Takkyu Ishino, was released in December of 2008. Skipping to 2010, he would release his second album titled Equal which managed to rank in the Japanese Albums Charts.

In 2011, Kensuke and former musicians from the bands Supercar and Number Girl formed a rock band called Lama. The band has released two albums, which both managed to rank in the official Albums Charts of Japan.  It was later revealed that due to his involvement in the rock band Lama, he wouldn't be able to release a third album until 6 years after his second album. His third album titled The Shader was released in 2016.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanashi742)

Cedric Herole is a Japan-based French animator who has worked on video games, anime and other forms of media. Herole worked with pH studio from 2005-2010 as a CGI animator for the pre-rendered cutscenes in Metroid: Other M. He also animated for the PlayStation 3 game Battle Princess of Arcadias. As of 2011, Cedric Herole works freelance.
Nishimura Iku (西村郁) is a Japanese animator and animation director.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Website](http://onukitaeko.jp/)

Oonuki Taeko is a singer-songwriter from Hayama, Miura, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan.
